thread.title: FACULTY AWARD: Metcalf awarded by Wellcome Fund to study population, disease dynamics
thread.title_full: FACULTY AWARD: Metcalf awarded by Wellcome Fund to study population, disease dynamics

author: Staff
title: FACULTY AWARD: Metcalf awarded by Wellcome Fund to study population, disease dynamics
text:
FACULTY AWARD: Metcalf awarded by Wellcome Fund to study population, disease dynamics Posted September 15, 2015; 05:00 p.m.   
C. Jessica Metcalf , a Princeton University assistant professor of ecology and evolutionary biology and public affairs , was one of 10 professors whose projects were chosen by the London-based Wellcome Fund for a new five-year, Â£75 million ($115 million) international initiative to study the links between human health and the health of the environment. Metcalf will use mobile-phone data to study shifting patterns of population density and how large-scale movement can drive patterns of disease, including outbreaks. The grant for Metcalf will be administered by the Princeton Environmental Institute
